This module contains the main loop for the VM.

Here:

  • we take a Translation object
  • go through each and every one of the bytecode instructions and execute them, one by one

The main entry point is execBlock.

Imports

bytecode, errors, eval, globals, parse, profiler, stack, values/value, values/custom/vbinary, values/custom/vlogical

Procs

proc execDictionary(blk: Value): ValueDict {....raises: [KeyError, Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Execute given Block value and return a Dictionary 
proc execFunction(fun: Value; fid: Hash) {....raises: [KeyError, Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect].}

Execute given Function value with scoping

This means:

  • All symbols declared inside will NOT be available in the outer scope
  • Symbols re-assigned inside will NOT overwrite the value in the outer scope
  • Symbols declared in .exports will not abide by this rule
  • If the whole function is marked as .exportable, then none of the symbols will abide by this rule and it will behave pretty much like execLeakless
proc ExecLoop(cnst: ValueArray; it: VBinary) {....raises: [Exception, KeyError],
    tags: [RootEffect].}

The main execution loop.

It takes an array of constants, our data (cnst) and array of bytes, our instructions/bytecode (it), goes through them and executes them one-by-one

Hint: Not to be called directly! Better use one of the helpers above!

Templates

template callFunction(f: Value; fnName: string = "<closure>"): untyped
Take a Function value, whether a user or a built-in one, and execute it 
template callInternal(fname: string; getValue: bool; args: varargs[Value]): untyped
Call function by name, directly and - optionally - return the result 
template execInternal(path: string)
Execute internal script using given path 
template execUnscoped(input: Translation or Value)

Execute given bytecode without scoping

This means:

  • Symbols declared inside will be available in the outer scope
  • Symbols re-assigned inside will overwrite the value in the outer scope (if it exists)
template finalizeLeakless(): untyped

Finalize leak-less block execution

Hint: To be used in the Iterators module

template handleBranching(tryDoing, finalize: untyped): untyped
Wrapper for code that may throw Break or Continue signals, or other errors that are to be caught 
template prepareLeakless(protected: ValueArray): untyped

Prepare for leak-less block execution

Hint: To be used in the Iterators module
